Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here Under Any Circumstances”
Reviews.Author: lovingthetravelingli
Reviews.Content: I have lived on five continents and travelled extensively, including all throughout Egypt and Guatemala (developing nations), but I have never been in a hotel as disgusting as this. I have never seen a hotel room so filthy. Everything was dirty: the sheets, the table, the chairs, the walls, the curtains, the end table, the carpet. The bathroom had mold in the shower, the sink, and the wall. I have never been so disinclined to touch anything in a hotel room. I booked this hotel for 3 weeks and left after the first night. The staff are an odd mix of dismissive and rude, and I cannot emphasize how run-down and dirty the building itself was. I was on the top floor, which is quite a climb, but it's also not quiet. The walls are astonishingly thin, so I could hear anytime anyone did anything, and there is a fire door that slams constantly. Do not set foot in this hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: badge_12
Reviews.Content: bad moldy rooms. very poor staff atitude. Skip this place, any good reviws you see are not true.

Reviews.Title: “For $75 in London you can't complain much.”
Reviews.Author: WIKITRAVELPEDIA
Reviews.Content: Located a short walk from 3 tube stations and Kensington Gardens Park, the Blue Bells Hotel is centrally located. This, however might be the only good thing this place has going for it. Considering I only paid $75 per night and that included wi-fi in your room and daily breakfast I can’t be too harsh on this place. More of a motel than a hotel, the room was small but relatively comfortable, the bathroom had some issues and stating the place offered cable tv in your room is an outright lie. Only three channels & no remote. I had no expectations going in, so I wasn’t totally disappointed, I just reminded myself that I was only paying 48 Pound Sterling. I paid more than that for dinner several times so the overall hotel experience is acceptable once you put it in perspective given the short amount of time you spend there. If you expect a phone or alarm clock in your room, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “I realize you get what you pay for, but...”
Reviews.Author: rrdub
Reviews.Content: this establishment is truly not up to the standard of "hotel." My college dorm was in better condition. I am not sure when the photos in the brochure were taken but the room we rented did not have nice furniture- it was old, stained and broken. Carpet was dirty. Walls were dirty- had not been painted in years and a new coat of paint might cover all the stains and scuff marks and water damage, not to mention the holes in the walls. Curtains were falling down and windows were filthy. Lights around bathroom mirror were broken, hairdryer did not work, TV remote broken, only half the outlets in the room did anything. One night we were cold and there was not heat control in the room. Another night we had no hot water. We were there 4 nights and every day they promised to fix/replace broken hair dryer and it was not done until the last day. I am not sure what the maids did, other than remake the bed....dirty tea cups and trash was not removed....wet towels were not replaced, bathroom was not cleaned. Shower had only a half door so bathroom floor was flooded after showers and no bathmat or anything other than towels to mop up... toilets had to be flushed 3-4x.....the list goes on. Worst part was the staff was completly unconcerned and did nothing they said they would, in fact asked us to leave early so they could get someone else in the room. We were on the top floor and could hear the subway rumble every 5 minutes as it shook the whole building, I can't even imagine what it would be like on lower floors trying to sleep under those conditions. Beds were surprisingly comfortable considering everything else. Location was great...thats about it.

Reviews.Title: “Nothings Changed Since 2007!”
Reviews.Author: JHusack
Reviews.Content: This place looks nice on the outside - but the inside and the owner/staff are horrible. Stinky, moldy smelling rooms - bathroom was clean - but the rest of the place was disgusting. Did not eat the breakfast as the "dining" area was filthy as well. The toilet from the upstairs room overflowed into our room - came back from sightseeing to wet carpet, towels on the floor and buckets catching the drips. When we asked to be moved they wanted to put us in a windowless basement room, which smelled even worse then our wet room - we declined and asked for our third nights $$$ to be refunded - the night manager refused - after a shouting match (which I NEVER do) we left in the night for another hotel. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!!!!!!!!!! One more thing, the "garden" out back was full of weeds and trash - nasty owners - nasty facility.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for.”
Reviews.Author: gamfruit
Reviews.Content: It was a cheap Â£60 for a two-bed room in the height of summer. So it was not expensive at all. And as you would probably have guessed already, it wasn't spectacular either. I have included some photos to let you be the judge of that. The carpet was in an unspeakable state. The small table from IKEA had a very damaged surface. As a consolation the front desk staff was friendly and so was the lady in the breakfast room. She was almost always speed walking on her two feet so I don't think it would be fair to blame her if service at breakfast was poor. I think I am giving a very generous AVERAGE here but I was conscious of all the bad comments about this hotel and the price when I booked so I wanted to be fair.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous-DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: Paula G
Reviews.Content: Surly unhelpful staff. Room was dark and dirty, stained dirty carpet,of the 3 pieces of furniture in the room all were broken and dirty, room was advertised as a double, it clearly wasn't! to get from one side of the room to the other you had to side step past the end of the bed and the dirty wall or climb over the bed. No tea or coffee making facilities in the room. When my husband enquired about the tea & coffe we were told it would be placed in our room the next day, of course it wasn't, when he again enquired he was told "no tea or coffee facilities in the room" but staff would make us a drink-but not now as they were asleep (10.30pm) On to the bathroom - broken tiled floor,broken and cracked mirror,shelf on the mirror falling off,unable to stand any toiletries on it as they fell off, no hot water in the mornings, dirt around taps and pipes, dirty grout on the tiles. Continental breakfast consisted of cereal, toast, tea or coffee. Not enough tables & chairs for guests - we ended up sitting on a dirty old sofa to eat our breakfast - needless to say we didn't bother the next day, we went out and found a cafe. One good point-the location of the hotel is in a nice quiet area away from mainstream traffic.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel, but ask for a bright room on 1st or 2nd floor!”
Reviews.Author: slovixi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok as long as you do not stay in the rooms in the basement/ground floor (very noisy because of the tube). The bathroom was clean, the bedroom looked clean, but had a funky smell. We were four friends and booked two double rooms (at the same price), one room was tiny, the other one was twice the size and much nicer and brighter. There was no hot water for two days, but the staff did what they could to fix it, and we got a dicount because of it. Service was quite good. Breakfast I would eat elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting Hotel....DO NOT STAY THERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: CowanJ
Reviews.Content: Terrible hotel: Dirty Rooms No Hot Water No clean towels No telephone Reception person lied to me several times I had to take my family to another hotel. When the taxi came to pick up the family the reception person did not give a message to the family and the taxi driver gave up Do not go there!

Reviews.Title: “Utter Joke”
Reviews.Author: Adrian P
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week. Thought people writing bad reviews about this hotel were exaggerating; not now, that I stayed there for a short trip to London with my gf. We arrived at noon and were told that our room was not ready until after 2pm; that's perfectley fine. We came back at 3pm only to be told by the receptionist to wait for 5minutes so he can eat!!! Then after 15 minutes while he meticulously eated his lunch he told us that the room was still not ready. We waited for another 15 minutes, and he told us that they didn't have the room we requested ( and confirmed by email) on the 1st floor. He had only 1 room left in the basement and believe me when I say that the room shaked when an underground train passed underneath. We didn't want the room and he told us that we can leave if we wanted to with a smile on his face. After a long and heated discussion my gf broke down crying and then he offered to move people from a 3rd floor room and put us there. I could not believe my eyes! I never saw anything like this done before in a hotel. After 2nights (out of 4) they told us that we needed to change the room as the one they gave us was a triple room and they needed it for other guests. At least they gave us one on the same floor. The rooms are ok (badly in need of refurbishment). Breakfast? we didn't dare to taste it. Avoid this hotel. And I'm not exaggerating. They nearly ruined much of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely awful!!”
Reviews.Author: lkrx4
Reviews.Content: I took my 4 children for a couple of nights in London at half term and we stayed at Blue Bells Hotel in Nottinghill Gate. The staff were very unfriendly and the hotel very shabby but the worst thing was the constant noise of trains running under the hotel!! Two of my children are special needs and i phoned the hotel at least 6 times before our trip to check that the hotel was reasonably quiet and i was reassured that it was!! I feel so angry because this hotel ruined our trip. When we left the staff didnt apologise in fact they didnt even say goodbye!

Reviews.Title: “Saying it's a dump is being polite!!”
Reviews.Author: Susedunne_2
Reviews.Content: We arrived to the "hotel" feeling quite tired so was looking forward to a lie down before touring the city. We were sent to a basement room & my poor fiance had to carry the suitcases down the stairs. We were greeted to a stain, looked & smelt like vom right outside the door. Windows didn't open & every few mins we shook as a tube train went under us!!! Nightmare from start to finish. Good point was the area itself. Staff were rude thats when they were about!! Great location, crap hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Probably the worst hotel I have ever stayed in, even as a student.”
Reviews.Author: Richard186288
Reviews.Content: Dirty. Disgusting. Filthy. Uncaring. Noisy beyond belief - the tube line underneath is like having a train go through your room every ten minutes. Their PR is a complete lie from beginning to end.. Boutique hotel my foot. It doesn't even know its own name , keeps changing the spelling. Should actually be re-named the Blue Hell. Do yourself a favour - D0 DO NOT STAY HERE. EVER.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: MarcoG_1980
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving our room wasnt ready as we were a few hours before check in time. They let us store our luggage in a closet while we went to a nearby pub for drinks. Returned a while later and were able to check in. We had a group of 5 so we had a pretty big room, it was clean and had what you would need, our own restroom, fridge and TV. Wi-Fi worked great and it was free which was great to avoid charges on my phone. The location was away from the city center but still plenty of pubs & restaurants around the area. The tube station was right around the corner so you could connect to all of London from there. All in all, for the price compared to other places if you're just looking for a place to sleep at a cheap rate and dont care about little things like room service, pool etc then this is a great spot.

Reviews.Title: “Value, good location, clean, basic, inadequate attention to services”
Reviews.Author: fairbairn
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located around the corner from Notting Hill Gate tube station. Quiet location but be aware there there is a regular rumble from the tube train. The rumble did not negatively affect us. There was free Wifi thank goodness. A very basic breakfast is provided but there is not enough room in the dining area when the hotel is busy. The rooms were hopeless with the details. Carpet and walls grubby. Hair dryer over heated very quickly and cut out. The shower did not fit up on the fitting and dribbled water so had to take a bath which I hate. There were no bedside lights so reading at night was nearly impossible. There was no bath mat for the bathroom so the floor got very wet. All in all this hotel was disappointing especially since I had stayed here once before on my own and had not noticed these things. I felt the hotel had dropped its game in the last 18 months. I will not use it again.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID”
Reviews.Author: TFFI
Reviews.Content: We selected the Blue Bells Hotel because of it's location, it is right in the heart of Notting Hill. Well thats the good points out of the way and here is why you shouldn't stay here, firstly when we arrived the receptionist was taking two personal calls on his phone(s) whilst checking us in, before passing us a key and gesturing downstairs. We had a basement room and within 5 minutes we realised that the hotel is located directly above 2 tube-lines, why the hotel decided to use the basement rooms knowing that sleeping in them before 1 am and after 4:30 am would be impossible I don't know. Secondly, we had booked a double room, we got two poor quality single beds pushed together with a rather large ridge between them. We asked to be moved to another room but the receptionist said "no", clearly this hotel has caused them a lot of stress in the past because he didn't even bother to ask what was wrong with our room. Also, if you are planning on arriving late (after 9 pm) then good luck, one man had booked a room only to arrive and be told that all the rooms had been booked up, a clever tactic by the hotel since they know many customers will end their stay early. After approximately 3 hours sleep we went upstairs with our bags packed and told the receptionist that we were leaving, he did offer us another room (which was on a higher floor, but filthy, and you could still hear the tube underneath), we said that we didn't want to stay in any of their rooms. One more plus point is if you shout at them then they will give in and only charge for one nights stay. This is a very poor quality hotel, even if the tube (which they obviously can't do much about) is ignored, this is still the worst hotel I have ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE.”
Reviews.Author: LolCri1234
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a long long day of travelling to be informed that (even though we had confirmed our booking 3 weeks prior-- before we left home, AND the morning of our first night before we left Copenhagen) they did NOT have any record of our booking-- DESPITE the fact that we had the confirmation in hand. The manager told us that there was nothing he could do, other than relocate us to one of this other hotels which was a mile away! we insisted he find us something in Notting Hill due to the fact that our tour left Notting Hill at 6am the next morning. After three hours he produced an extremely over priced, extremely dirty alternative and offered us no compensation. NOT IMPRESSED. I believe that they purposely overbook, a kind of first in get the room, last in get shoved off to their other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad choice for the price”
Reviews.Author: altichick
Reviews.Content: We booked through Laterooms and paid 60 GBP for a twin En-suite inc continental breakfast. Pros: Great location, safe, quiet and pleasant street less than 5 mins from Notting Hill Gate tube and a few mins walk from Hyde Park. A few mins walk to local shops / pubs / restaurants. We booked a twin and were pleasanatly surprised to have been given a large room in the basement with a double and a single bed as well as a bunk bed!!. The room and bathroom were clean. There was a fridge and tea/coffee making facilities. 24 Hour reception where the staff were polite. Breakfast was adequate (toast & cereals) although no fresh juice only fruit squash/ cordial. Cons: The basement room must have been near an underground train line as there were considerable noise and vibrations at 15 - 30 min intervals throughout the day. These did stop after midnight and resumed again at about 5am though with less frequency between 5 and 7am. I'm a fairly heavy sleeper and only stayed one night to see a show/ sight see so it wasn't a major problem. Overall: for the great price and location this was perfect for a one night stay.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is totally misrepresented on their website”
Reviews.Author: GatsbyGal
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel July 2006. Not sure if it is still in business, though it's website is still up and running. The 18th Century Victorian is a beautiful building in a fantastic neighborhood. My room was on the third floor and there was not lift. The clerk helped to carry my bags upstairs, thankfully. I got into the room and the double bed nearly took up every square inch of the room. "Oh well," I thought. "This is London. Rooms will be small." I had just flown in from the US and after taking the train from Gatwick, then the tube, I was plain exhausted. I laid down on the bed and was lying in my...well...my underwear (it was record heat in London that summer and no air conditioning in the room), when someone tried opening the door. It apparently didn't lock! Not just that one time, but it DOESN'T LOCK. I had to stack my suitcase and carry on bag in front of the door. The bed was dismal. It looks like they got the linens from a second-hand store. The bathroom light fixture was hanging out of the wall on it's poor electrical wire. I was spending the first 5 days in London solo and then I was rendezvousing with a suitor who would be coming in from Scotland. "Holy cow," I thought to myself. "This place looks like a pay-by-the-hour dump." I was mortified. Apparently, the Tube was underneath our hotel and even though I was on the third floor, the place shook like crazy and it sounded as though I was right on top of the train. But the absolutely most priceless part of the whole thing was the fire alarm that went of FOUR TIMES DURING THE NIGHT and stayed on during the day. This went on for TWO DAYS. Management told me that there was a problem with the fire alarm and they were trying to get it fixed. Breakfast was paltry. Cereal and warm juice. It was meager and just plain sad. What makes me chuckle is that my first morning there, there was a long line of people (myself included) waiting to get on the computer. We were all looking for another place to stay. It was tough. Wimbledon was going on and The World Cup was going on in Europe that year, so there were more travelers than usual in England. (sigh) I did find a place in the same neighborhood--The Lennox Hotel--which was significantly more, but I needed a place...ANY place that wasn't the Blue Bells Hotel. But let me tell you the one bright spot about Blue Bells Hotel. The management did not charge me a penalty for leaving early. I went in on Wednesday and said I was checking out the next morning (I had it booked through Saturday). They were amazingly accommodating and even offered to help me with my bags. When I left the morning I checked out, it was a bit drizzly in the morning. I walked out with a big smile on my face, knowing that I was going around the corner to a much better hotel when I slipped on the steps and fell hard on my bum. All I could do was laugh, as it seemed to be such a fitting finish for my experience at this dump of a place. (For what happened next, check out my review of The Lennox Hotel.)

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a budget hotel, but could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: martijnvanluijn
Reviews.Content: Nestled in a beautiful street across from a park and surrounded by the static houses of Kensington and Notting Hill this hotel gives overall good value for your money. Our room was very small and on the top floor without elevator and although the bedding was clean the rest of the room could have been cleaner. The hotel gives the impression that they could do better. i's are not dotted and t's are not crossed. With a little more effort this could be a great place to stay. Having said that, the staff was very friendly and helpful. We traveled with a 2 year old and a 17 year old. It is not the best kids friendly hotel with little to no amenities for children. Very close to Tube stations, portobello street (portobello market is about a 15min walk), Queens Way and Hyde Park (great for kids).

Reviews.Title: “suck hotel”
Reviews.Author: wakakaHk
Reviews.Content: I've been there for a week , frankly speaking the staffs working there are really nice and helpful. However, the environment of the hostel is terrible, the room itself is really small and only one person can squeeze into the washroom. Crappy bed and shakey furnitures.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold and just plain horrible”
Reviews.Author: marcigower
Reviews.Content: I traveled to London with my elderly mother and secured a room on the ground floor 2 months in advance so she wouldn't have to walk any steps due to her age. When we arrived from the airport at 12:30pm in what was the coldest, snowiest winter in 30 years, we were told to come back after 2pm as our room wasn't ready, and were not even invited to wait in the lounge (we insisted - it was freezing outside and we were exhausted). The room we were given was up 2 flights of steps and was bitter cold and did not have double glazed windows, or more than a thread bare duvet on the beds. We asked for more blankets and were given only one even though there were two beds. The heating didn't come on well and we shivered terribly. The bathroom was barely big enough to close the door once sat on the toilet!!! The room was also not very clean at all and the decor was very dated and chipped and tatty. Just horrible and nothing at all like any of the pictures noted. It was downright depressing. Yes, the noise and rattling from the underground was ridiculous, but for the price that could have been overlooked with earplugs if it would have just been reasonably warm and clean. The staff also insisted on taking the key back from us any time we left the hotel premises, which was odd, as all of our valuables were in the room. This made us very uncomfortable. It's a real shame as the location is fabulous and the building and the Notting Hill neighborhood is really charming, but I'd never stay there again or recommend anyone to stay there. In fact, RUN AWAY. Especially if it's cold... There are much better options for a slightly little more money.

Reviews.Title: “The good location doesn't make up for the poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Ginkg0
Reviews.Content: We spent only one night here and that was enough. Although we called to confirm our booking, when we arrived they said they didn't have a booking for us. They did find a room for us, but were quite unfriendly and unhelpful. The whole building shook every 5 minutes from the underground and there was also a lot of noise from other rooms until about 2am. The room was large enough but run down, especially the bathroom. The breakfast was very average and the coffee was terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Shaking house and no sleep”
Reviews.Author: smith5424
Reviews.Content: Had I known that the hotel was directly above the Underground and that the building shook from 6AM until Midnight, I would not have stayed here. Fortunately, I only had to stay for one night or else I would have gone elsewhere for the remainder of the trip. Additionally, I worked with the front-desk person to secure a 6AM taxi to Gatwick the following morning upon check-in. At around MIDNIGHT (well after I went to bed) I was startled to here knocking at the door from a different front-desk person to confirm the taxi pickup. The room was odorous and tiny. And when our taxi arrived early the next morning the front-desk attendant knocked on our door to let us know, but he also simultaneously came well into the heart of the tiny room while we were finishing getting ready to take away our room key - while we appreciated the notice that our taxi was there, we did not particularly like the unexpected intrusion into the room to grab away our room key. Location and price are about the only thing this hotel has going for them. I will never stay here again and will advise everyone else to avoid as well - I like sleep and privacy when I purchase a night at a hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “Someone should steal a star or two from this place...”
Reviews.Author: betsyvance
Reviews.Content: Aside from the cleanliness of the room and the location I can't really say much more in positive terms.. The staff were unfriendly and unwelcoming and looked as though they didn't want us to check in. I disliked the fact that we couldn't check in before 2pm and when we did arrive at 2pm our room was not ready and we had to wait. In additon to this we could hear the underground alot, there were weird noises in our bathroom, the bedroom window didn't close, there were two singles beds pushed together to make a double and the breakfast was very very basic. I also had an issue with our key which seemed to stick in the door. However, the price was good and it was a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: loiswein
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked a room for two nights at this hotel in March 2009. We arrived on June 10, 2009 for the beginning of our stay with our confirmation in hand. The manager refused to give us a room!! He said that they had no rooms, but that he would find us a room at anothet hotel. While we waited he registered other people who were also checking in. When we asked why he couldn't give us a room, he said he had no more. He found us a room at the Notting Hill Hotel which was the filthiest, most disgusting place I have ever stayed. When we went back to complain to the Blue Bells Hotel, the manager said there was nothing he could do except lower the price by 5 British pounds. We had to stay in a room where the toilet leaked on to the floor and the bedding was not clean neither was the furniture. Beware, if you book a room at the Blue Bells Hotel (a 3 star hotel), you may end up staying at a no star hotel. It doesn't matter if you have a confirmation or not.

Reviews.Title: “"Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: msmarket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend, and thought it was a pretty nice stay. Nice staff, very helpful. the room was small, but was ok for me. The rooms were clean. My two complaints about this hotel was the two twin beds pushed together to make a full, not a good idea. I kept falling between the beds.Oh yeah the tube runs under the hotel so be ready for a some noise and shaking inthe tunnel. lol I would stay here again and the location was very close to the tube. My long late nights made it easy for me to sleep thru the tube train.

Reviews.Title: “We'll be back !”
Reviews.Author: FamZ
Reviews.Content: Thank You for once again a pleasent stay in a beautiful part of London. We enjoy the atmosphere and the quite street with beautiful trees and white houses close to the underground. Service minded and always pleasant personell. The rooms we have had in our four visits have high celings and are spacious. The breakfast is simple and the breakfast room a bit small, but I know the hotel is making roomarrangements already. We will be back again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: tiinaah
Reviews.Content: After reading the latest reviews of this hotel (before we left) me and my mum were a bit uncertain about whether we should find a new hotel or not. Now I'm glad we decided to give this hotel a try! It wasn't at all as bad as many people made it sound! We asked for a room on a lower floor because of my mum's back problems, even though we've read that the Underground was "unbarable" lower down. We got a twin room on the first floor. We didn't mind about the Underground, sure, it made some noise but on the evenings the trains didn't go very often. The room was quite small but ok, I mean, you don't go to London to sit at the hotel all the time. We had a window with a view of a brick wall, again, we didn't mind. At least there was a window! The bathroom was clean and modern and we also had a bathtub. The thing is - we couldn't use the tub because we could only get water from the shower thing and while filling the tub from the shower the water almost got cold. There was a rather large color tv in the room, hairdryer, telephone and coffee- and tea making facilities. The room was overall a bit worn out but the beds were comfortable. It was very hot in the room, we tried to turn down the heat but it didn't work so we kept the window open which was a bit of a challenge but the room got cooler. There was also free wireless internet access that I could use in the room and not only in the common areas. All of the staff was nice and friendly. One thing was a bit odd - when you left the room you had to leave the key at the reception and then get in when you came back. They said it was for safety reasons. The hotel had a luggage room where you could leave your luggage before checking in and after checking out which was very good so you didn't have to carry it all around! Breakfast was totally ok, toast with different sorts of jam, cereal, milk, juice, tea and coffee. There could've been some cheese too, but other from that it was good. Location of this hotel is excellent - just a couple of minutes walk from Notting Hill Gate, shops, food, parks and of course Portobello Road. And it is beautifully located just near Pembridge Square.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO HERE! You can't be sure to get a room, even though you booked”
Reviews.Author: MetteKCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at the Hotel Blue Bells over the Internet. When I and my family arrived at the Hotel Blue Bells at 8 in the evening, we were told, that due to rebuilding, there was no room for us, and that we would be transferred to another hotel with the same owners in another part of town. Having a very tired 4 year old with us, we decided - after having argued with the receptionist for a while, to go to the other hotel - Chelsea House Hotel. We had deliberatly booked at Hotel Blue Bells because of the excellent location, so it was quite a dissapointment to be taken to a whole different area of town, that didn't at all live up to our expectations. Our room at Chelsea House Hotel had one naked lightbulb in the ceiling, it was dirty and there was rat poison in the bath room (no kidding). We spend one night and got out as fast as we could the next morning! So AVOID both Hotel Blue Bells and Chelsea House Hotel. The service is horrible, the standard is horrible and it is not at all what it looks like on the internet!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom83
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews for this hotel, we almost cancelled our reservation. But then we realized that most of the reviews on the other hotels we were looking at were also negative so it seems that people are quick to complain, but do not always take the time to compliment. So here is a different opinion of Blue Bells: We stayed for 6 nights, and we had a room on the top floor. There is no elevator, so getting the bags upstairs was a bit of a struggle, but lack of an elevator is common in European hotels in this category, so that was not an unexpected problem. The room was large with 2 twin beds and a television. Both the room and the modern bathroom were very clean and the towels provided were as large as beach towels, much better than you find at budget hotels in the US. There is a hairdryer in the bathroom, so no need to bring one from home. There was also a refrigerator in the room, and the staff was more than accommodating in providing glasses for us take to our room so we could enjoy cold drinks. There was an electric pot for heating water, which was helpful when my companion caught a cold and needed to take medicine dissolved in hot water. All in all, the room was very comfortable and perfect for our needs. You do hear the Underground from time to time (even on the top floor) but it does not run all night, so it did not bother us. I can imagine if you were on a lower floor you might have more of a problem with that. Surprisingly, the walls are not soundproof, so we could hear quite a bit of noise from our neighbors. But that is not the fault of the hotel, that is the fault with people not being considerate of others around them and being too loud late at night. But again, it was not that much of a problem. About the only complaint that I would have about the room was that there was not good lighting by the beds. The only light in the room was the main overhead light. It would have been nice to have a light by the bedside. The breakfast was simple but satisfying (toast, cereal, orange juice, tea/coffee). If you are looking for more than that, you would have to go out. But it was typical of a continental breakfast in many hotels and the service was always prompt and friendly. The staff at the hotel was helpful and accommodating. There is a computer for guests to use in the breakfast room, so we were able to check online for tours and activities. That was a big surprise as most hotels in this category don't have internet access for their guests. All in all, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to go back. We definitely got our money's worth. At the rate we paid, we were not expecting a deluxe hotel, and it is certainly not in that category, but for a moderate hotel, it was great. The staff did admit that some of their rooms are not as nice as others, so you would want to be sure to request a room on the upper floors. It was worth climbing the stairs to get to a better room. Oh, and they do have a room for storing luggage if you arrive early or leave late. That was a big plus when we arrived as we could just drop off our suitcases and get started seeing the sights!

Reviews.Title: “dont judge a place by its cover, it ant what you think inisde”
Reviews.Author: stevenreid
Reviews.Content: I went here 21-25march 09, my double room was not like the pics in web page, the room was dirty, had rat traps under the bed, which was two single beds pushed together, kept coming apart all night, all the room was outdated, no lamps or nice bed linen. towels or bed sheets were never changed in 4 days. Curtians were rotten, window in room was broken. room was very hot, only good point about this place, i seen the reviews before going here, but thought il give it ago, cant be that bad, well im sorry i did now. believe me im not hrad to please for accomadation, but this was totally a mess, the people there didnt care about the guest either, I went there see it, and never again.

Reviews.Title: “It really is bad”
Reviews.Author: DarlaTex
Reviews.Content: I gave this b&b a good chance, staying here three times over the past 5 years, for five or six nights each time. The last two visits they didn't have my room available and I had to stay in a teensy single and then move. Both times I requested a specific room, which was confirmed...but not really apparently. Beds are terrible, decor is ugly, and the "breakfast" truly sux. They have a new "manager" who I would characterize as surly and unhelpful, more interested in his computer. NEVER AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marthaifarta
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel I have EVER been to!!! We got in late at night, tired and just wanted a bed to sleep in. We got the key and dragged the suitcases up the many, many stairs to our designated room. We got 1 double bed and two singles, looking (even though it was dark and we were very tired) flat out dirty! The next day we could actually see all the dirt (linens, windows, floor, bathroom...) and wanted to find another hotel. After searching nearby hotels, we found that they were fully booked and togheter with the other couple we were travelling with, that we would stick out one more night, as we weren't spending much time in the room. Our friends didn't have water in their shower saturday morning, so they had to use our shower. They didn't even have a key for their door and had to get the clerk open and closing the door when they were going in or out. That was until we actually found out that the key me and my boyfriend got, was actually the master key and could be used for their door as well. Splendid!!! Gosh.... On sunday morning when we were checking out, we tried to complain, only to be met with an argument we certaintly didn't expect; "Bad room, you say?? If you think your room was bad, you should go up to room number 6 and take a look, because THAT room is really bad." Enough said.......

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Heyerette
Reviews.Content: We were so disappointed with this hotel - and could have saved us so much time and trouble making our choice in the end. No 3 stars should be attributed to them (though perhaps there are actually one or two rooms which look something akin to those presented on websites) - our room was a hovel. Tiny beyond description, dirty sheets and mattresses, the walls in a state, the bathroom pretty disgusting. The area itself, it is in Notting Hill is quite lovely and the building that houses the hotel as well, but our stay was nothing but awful - from the check-in to the room to breakfast (hardly any space, no choice at all - and we really are not picky - we quickly opted to eat out). You can have so much better on a budget - at the very least cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “clean, large rooms, helful staff”
Reviews.Author: nemurerubijin
Reviews.Content: My priority was claenness and I am totally satisfied. Rooms are large and furniture not that new, but hygiene is ok. The nearest subway station is Notting Hill Gate, 150 mt, an easy walk of 2 minutes or less. Plus area is safe at night also for women, and there is night bus service too. Staff is Indian and very helpful and nice. Now a few negative notes: subway runs under this area so hotel shackes a bit. Some rooms overlook the main square but some others face the wall of another building. Only 1 hand shop/guest no other courtesy set (body shop, shampoo, etc.). Perhaps if you ask they get you, but I did not. Price is very convenient, I would recommend this place, and shall stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for the money!”
Reviews.Author: katw83
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Blue Bells with my two friends for two nights last week and I have to say I was pleasantly surprised. We had a nice welcome from the staff but it soon became evident when we were standing at the welcome desk that the noise (and vibrations) of the underground was going to be a major problem if we were staying in the basement (or even at ground level) Luckily we were given a room on the top floor. There wasn't a lift but it wasn't too much of a problem with us as we only had small bags. The room wasn't greatly decorated, probably could do with a lick of paint and a new carpet but its was clean and the bathroom looked relatively new. The shower wasn't great but worked enough to give the three of us showers on each of the days. The staff were helpful enough when we asked questions about the surrounding areas and taxis. And as for the underground we barely heard it. Overall I think I would definately stay at this hotel again (although be sure to get a 2nd or 3rd floor room) For the price (especially in London) I think we got quite a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: maher45
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with fantastic location.Our family has just returned from 10 days at the Holiday Inn staying in a Family Suite. Couldn't fault the hotel. Staff were lovely, helpful and always smiling. The Family Suites were just great and ideal way of having your own space. I will go back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “not bed”
Reviews.Author: wessangggg
Reviews.Content: stayed there for 3 nights. the service was nice, the room was clear and the hotel was alt. the people working there were helpful to give some hints for singhtseein. it was very good ! breakfast was good too !

Reviews.Title: “DISHONEST PLACE”
Reviews.Author: romanglobe
Reviews.Content: I bought two tickets for the champions league match CHELSEA-ROMA. The match took place on Wednesday the 22nd on October in London and it was agreed with the tickets provider that the delivery was going to be to the hotel where I was staying for the night. I sent to the hotel 3 emails informing them that I was going to receive a personal envelope before my arrival and asking to keep the envelope safe. I did not receive any answer to these emails. Then I contacted by phone the hotel on Sunday the 19th and the guy in the reception confirmed that he received the envelope. I arrived at the hotel around 2 oâ€™clock in the afternoon and the same guy at the reception whom I spoke to at the phone on Sunday told me that he did not receive any envelope for me; he suggested contacting the ticket company in order to verify the delivery. I contacted then ticket company provider and they confirmed that they sent the ticket and they had the signature of the guy who received on hand the envelope. I asked them to send by email this document . The guy in the reception recognise his signature and confirmed that â€˜â€™nowâ€™â€™ he remembered about this envelope and that my name sounded â€˜â€™nowâ€™â€™ familiar!!! He told me then that he lost the envelope. I spoke with the hotel manager but with not success as well. The name of the guy, who named himself as Assistant manager(MACOJ is the name), was rude, not professional, dishonest and totally disorganized. Talking about the room, it was very small and basic,the shower was not working, quite dirty and noisy place. My sincere recommendation is to DO NOT STAY in this hotel. IT WAS TERRIBLE and the stuff is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “worth of money”
Reviews.Author: kayallory
Reviews.Content: Very good location , the employees are friendly and nice , good relation cost benefit. I realy recommend Bluebells hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bare basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Surfagirl
Reviews.Content: I arrived after a long flight from Dubai, in desperate need of a shower and very weary. I checked in to be given my room key and vague directions to my room. My room ended up being up 6 flights of stairs, there wasn't a lift and I wasn't given any assistance carrying my luggage up the stairs. Luckily i'm a fairly fit young female. I would not recommend this for anyone who has trouble with stairs or is slightly unfit in any way! The room was tiny and very musty though it was very clean. It was ok for a first day of arrival where you only needed a shower and sleep but would not recommend it for an extended stay. The staff were friendly but not very helpful. The breakfast started later than the time they told me. Overall, if it's just a room you are after, it's fine as it was clean.

Reviews.Title: “love it”
Reviews.Author: spinnerrr
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed stayig at hotel blue bells. I loved room quality, free wi-fi,location,distance of subway from hotel.Everything is cool. I am gonna go again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “terrible...”
Reviews.Author: RichHill1974
Reviews.Content: Not a good place to stay. It looks nice from the outside but the facade fools you. I stay in a lot of hotels in London because I end up having to work late on projects and I live in Coventry which is based in the midlands. Its just easier. There 'are' some good cheapish hotels in London but this is not one of them. I arrived at 1.30am to be greeted by a chap who was in a t-shirt and boxer shorts and sleeping in the reception area. I told him I had a booking , he gave me the keys to my room (13 !) and said I should fill the paper work out in the morning - first bad move - thats breaking the law. The room itself wasn't too bad - it was only in the morning I was to find bite marks from fleas... :-( The ensuite was suffice but the shower doors were literally hanging off. In the morning after realising I had been bitten I was in no mood for what was to come. I filled out the form I was supposed to fill out on arrival and the same chap who I saw when I checked in (!) wanted me to fill out the origin part (you know passport , ethnic background) I don't fill these out as I find them racist. He got rather upset. and made me feel quite bad. It certainly is NOT law to fill these parts out. Then I went for Breakfast. A room off the main hallway which looks presentable enough was being staffed by two people who looked like they could NOT care less. I asked if I was to sit somewhere - anywhere I was told. No places were set. It is self serve which is not too bad but I had to scrounge a cup and saucer from another table and there were no place settings. I was asked if I wanted toast - to which I got no knife and was just told 'Help yourself' as the waitress pointed to other tables that had some spare. To be honest I know what this hotel needs - it needs a little bit of TLC, some new managment who instill correct procedures and a little bit of investment. Its not far off from being ok but you can bet after this experience I will NOT being going back there. My suggestion are the hotels on Gower Street near Bloomsbury - closer to the hear of london and on the whole better than this dump.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it”
Reviews.Author: bearorso
Reviews.Content: Even for a modest B+B this place is a dump, with an oversized bed in an undersized room; peeling paint; shelves about to fall off the wall; a toilet seat that should have been retired a decade ago; a contnental breakfest that would leave most Continentals wondering where breakfast was. Further no safe for valuables - reception had trouble with that concept. The only bright spots were somewhat unreliable and free Wifi and a 5 minute walk to Notting Hill Gate tube station. If you are thinking about this as a place to stay in Londdon - lower your expectations. Having lived in this city and visited for 25 years this was a disappointment and I will not return. Sincerely, Al Troner

Reviews.Title: “Well...in hindsight, it could have been worse.”
Reviews.Author: TheHaases
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Blue Bells on two seperate occassions, the first for 4 nights, and the second for two. We went to Venice in between our two stays at the Blue Bells. Anyway, this was where we stayed for our honeymoon. The location is a 5-minute walk from the Notting Hill Gate Underground station. The first set of nights, we were put in a tiny room, (#32) which I expected without a refridgerator, like I had requested, and we were on the 3rd floor. The bathroom, while slightly grimy, was okay and even bigger than I expected. The bedding was clean, as were the towels, which were quite large. The tv worked and we felt we had enough room for our luggage(2 large suitcases, 2 carry-ons), we just had to be creative about it. The water was generally hot. The things that went wrong were as follows: Broken hairdryer - I was given one that did work, however, the phone doesn't call to the desk, so down the stairs I went. No heat - we did have two space heaters, one was broken. Outlets - one did not work, and the other one blew my adapter up. Water pressure - If you got in early enough, no problem. Sometimes we were lucky enough to get no pressure for about 5 minutes. The one phone to call out on in the lobby - did not work, supposly was to be repaired. Our second stay there, we were given a much bigger room (#22), with a smaller bathroom, but with a refridgerator. However, the beds were two twin sized ones, but we were able to push them together. The hair dryer and heat worked in this one, plus we even got a table, and more outlets. Wireless internet even worked on occasion in this room. What went wrong: The toilet seat was wooden...gross. The shower...my poor husband got a really cold shower with little to no water pressure on one occassion. The lamps - they could really use some lamp shades. Carpet - little bit dirtier than the first time. The one phone to call out on in the lobby - STILL did not work, supposly was to be repaired. Overall, the staff was mainily all foreign and generally not very knowledge of London sites and the hour of operations for many places. Wireless internet was free in the breakfast area. Breakfast was ho-hum. Cereal, coffee, tea, warm orange juice (which that's pretty much how it is in Europe), toast and jam. Nothing exciting there, but it was nice to grab something to eat and the lap-top and plan out the day. You basically get what you pay for, and in all honesty, we weren't traveling to stay in a hotel. We were hardly there, so it worked out okay for us. I wouldn't ever stay there again though.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty, noisy and insecure”
Reviews.Author: whymeSydney
Reviews.Content: Bed in twin room let as a single was comfortable and sheets and towels clean - which was just as well as they were not changed during my ten day stay. General air of grime and tattyness associated with all furniture fittings carpet and curtains. Bathroom a delight -floor tiles peeling away loose grit underneath. Toilet seat wooden, originally painted but now peeling. Some mention on this site of tube train noise - this is regular and soothing compared with the sounds of the plumbing. At least I hope it was the plumbing... Not allowed to keep key, but must return to desk. Desk is often unattended with permanent notice informing staff will be back in ?10 mins.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: missiles
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location, very central to all the major attractions. The stories about how small some London rooms were is true of Blue bells. The only way to open the suitcase was to put it on the bed. The shower was blocked which meant it was impossible to wash ones hair without flooding the bathroom. While the staff were good, breakfast was supposed to have been served from 7am. The breakfast room however did not open until 7:30 on both mornings, so don't expect to get and early start. We found it clean enough, great location and price, however, would probably try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel from Hell”
Reviews.Author: dansten
Reviews.Content: Booked to stay at this Hotel 13th October 2007.All the websites rate this as a 2 or 3 star hotel. Do not go near the place. Un inhabitable , dirty smelly place. On turning back the bed sheets the matress was stained with urine and " other brown stains" .We complained to the manager who offered us asnother room which was just as filthy. We turned and walked out with nowhere to stay on a Saturday night, but sleeping in the Blue Bells was not an option. Stay well clear.

Reviews.Title: “Oh my gosh!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mand9194
Reviews.Content: Imagine the worst hotel you have ever stopped in....... this is 100 times worse! We arrived just as a tube train passed below. I think I can still feel the vibrations now. I know, that's not the hotels fault but it didn't help. Our room, was on the top floor, large in size with an infestation of flies, the wall paper was peeling off, there was damp on the ceiling and walls and a very peculiar smell, which to this day I have not been able to identify! There was also a mismatch of furniture scattered around the room. You could not put anything in the wardrobe as the bed and bedside cabinet was blocking it off. The bathroom on the otherhand seemed to have recently been renovated and was actually quite nice. Breakfast was included, so when we went down in the morning we found there to be no juice, no cereal, no milk, no tea or coffee and no space to sit. There appeared to be seating for about 10, people were scattered all over the floor! We did not stop, there was a handy Starbucks round the corner!! The hotel building itself is beautiful, On a lovely square of similar type buildings, all it needs is a bit of cash and care spent on it and it could be lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Limit your expectation so not to be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: doctor998
Reviews.Content: There are only two reasons to stay at the Blue Bell Hotel in Paddington/ Kenningston area. They are price and location. If you are expecting anything more, stay elsewhere! The hotel is very basic having been converted from a large private residence. It is relatively clean and functional. Sufficient for sleeping, bathing and marginal continental breakfast. We arrived at 4:00 pm and our room was not : "ready Yet". We left our luggage which we had been told would be placed in our room. We left until 9:00 pm and our luggage was still in the office. So, I retrieved luggage and brought it to our room myself. Beware of the bathroom tub, There is no hand rail and the bathtub is slippery. My wife fell hard in tub. Thank God she did not break a leg. The splash guard on side of tub is not designed to be hand guard and gave way on her way down. Also, ventilation in bathroom is limited to small window out to breezeway. The tubes run underground. Every 15 minutes, sounds like a roller coaster runs in basement. This keeps up until 11:00 pm and starts again about 6:00 AM. Ear plugs made this manageable. The continental breakfast is very marginal . I was not expecting much and I was correct to do so. I had a much better included contentient breakfast elsewhere in London. The room where breakfast was held was tiny and too small for the number of travelers who filed in waiting for breakfast. The 2 ladies who worked there were alway very busy but little seemed to get done. I think this was their extra job before going elsewhere for their day job. Orange juice was served warm. Toast is your best bet although toaster was semi broken and only produced 3 slices at a time. I seemed uncomfortable asking for 8 slices for my family of 4. This was not adequate as 20 people filled the room and some were waiting in the television area waiting to get one of the too few seats... you get the idea. There is a free internet in the breakfast room. It is only 8 minutes brisk walk to tubes. Staff were helpful in calling taxi. Do remember ear plugs, beware of the bathroom as you might slip without tub handrail. I found Days Inn Westminster to be more modernized with better breakfast, but pricier. Blue bells is adequate for short stay near everything, not pricey, not luxurious, not for the traveler who expects anything above bare basics.

Reviews.Title: “better than expected”
Reviews.Author: itchytoes
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I spent 2 nights in summer 2007, 1 night in the twin bedroom and 1 night in the double bedroom. Before checking into this hotel, we had read a range of reviews. Hence, we had insisted on a room above ground level to avoid rumbling from the train line. True to expectations, the twin bedroom was claustrophobic, nondescript, with the bare essentials but clean. The double bedroom was airy, included a minifridge which was handy, and a very pleasantly clean bathroom. The rumbling can be largely ignored. At such a price, its location and pleasant surroundings, and for anyone who plans to spend little time in the room, this hotel is definitely worth recommending.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and friendly”
Reviews.Author: blackcob
Reviews.Content: Okay, so the decor is not too good, but the rooms are clean, the location is good for accessing the West End. I got a good price (Â£50/pn) which is good for the area. I also had a fridge in the room. The only bad point was that the whole hotel was absolutely roasting hot, even with the windows open.. however, if you don't mindwalking around your room in the buff and sleeping ontop of the sheets, this shouldn't be too much of a problem. Breakfast is basically coffee, toast and cereals

Reviews.Title: “Refurbished,,? Dont believe it!”
Reviews.Author: mouseyhoney
Reviews.Content: If you are booking via the hotel website dont believe everything you see or read. It says newly refurbished...maybe 15 years ago. The rooms are shabby, and the property is directly over the tube line making for a very noisy stay. If you have to stay there go to the top floor! My room had swathes of polyfilla on the walls to fill the cracks; and when upstairs flushed their loo you could hear the contents descending through the wall next to the bed. As for staff, rude and surly and so lazy. Breakfast never on time and just couldnt be bothered. There are better places to stay in London!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: hcwals88
Reviews.Content: Our stay there was nice nothing too fancy but the staff is friendly and our stay was nice and very convenient to the metro. I accidentally left behind a very nice purse there and was afraid when I called I would not be able to get it back. But they called me back the next day saying they found it and I was so pleased! Like I said very nice staff!

Reviews.Title: “An "S" missing, really a Hostel.”
Reviews.Author: ymclain
Reviews.Content: Booked through Londonrooms.biz. We arrived to find the hotel more of a hostel, as atleast 30 students were there. The rumble we heard occasionally was the tube! Our room was not ready at 5:30 pm. After waiting an hour, we saw our room which was nothing like the description. Heat for room was turned on from 7 pm to 6 am only. Bathroom was mildewy. We refused to stay and demanded that no charge be credited, which they agreed to. I will check my AMEX to be sure. There are better hostels in the area.

Reviews.Title: “BE WARNED”
Reviews.Author: GRANNYMC
Reviews.Content: I arranged a Christmas shopping trip to London with 3 friends and booked this hotel well in advance-I even contacted them. by phone, 2 days before arrival to reconfirm the booking. After our flight,train and tube journey, we arrived at the hotel to be told, by a smiling receptionist, that our room had been double booked and he had no other rooms available for us.He informed us that he had arranged another hotel for us and that he would pay for the taxi there. When we arrived at the other "hotel", we were in a state of both shock and disgust-it was uninhabitable, an absolute sesspit!! We then had to get another taxi and try and find somewhere else to stay, whiich we eventually did at 4.30pm. SO, BE WARNED, DO NOT BOOK THIS HOTEL IF YOU ARE RELYING ON YOUR ACCOMODATION!!!

Reviews.Title: “Basic no frills accomodation for central city....”
Reviews.Author: welshcookie
Reviews.Content: The Bluebell is a perfect example of the old adage...you get what you pay for.... it is in a great location and very reasonably priced, if you are looking for some luxury on 59 GBPs a night in central London then don't come here. However, if you don't intend to be be lolling around in your room all day and just looking for a place to lay your weary body for the night....then why not? Yes it is above the tube....I was on the first floor and have been more disturbed at night by heavy traffic than I was by the rumble of a tube. Cleaniness is not a high priority in this hotel.....the sight of a mouse trap inside the room was off putting and decided I would forgo the breakfast. The bathroom was pretty horrible...tiny, dirty, flies coming out of the plug hole and over flow etc. We were pretty pleased to be drunk at the end of each evening. The staff were friendly enough. But still....at 59 pounds a night it is a good deal....would we stay there again? no...probably not.

Reviews.Title: “Rubbish!”
Reviews.Author: tastefull-traveller
Reviews.Content: 'Worst Hotel I have ever stayed in' I sent my boss here last night after looking at the website and being quite impressed by the pictures. It is very hard to find a hotel at late notice in London therefore I was hoping that this The Bluebell would be a good one so that I could send more business their way. To my great shock and dissapointment he came to work this morning very tired having had only four hours sleep. Why was this? Because it has train tracks running above it and it is old and smelly with bad service. A true sign of the mixed reviews that you can get sometimes. I don't know how anyone could have enjoyed hearing trains pass every 2minutes. NEVER AGAIN

HotelInfo.Name: Blue Bells Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 14 Pembridge Square, Notting Hill Gate, London W2 4EH, England
